div1.p: Carter writes about his travels and his work.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, July 14, 1920
div1.opener:
Comisión Sanitaria
para los Departamentos de
Piura y Tumbex
Piura. Peru
July 14/20
My Dear Daughter:
div1.p:
I sent you one letter - mailed at Guaya-
quil about July 1: one from Payta July 3 or 4. & one
containing a paper on Gorgas death for the S. Med.
about the same date- The two from Payta were
mailed aboard s'o I hope you receive them.
I have rec'd the Testament - came on the same
boat with me - but no other letter up to yes-
terday - when I was in Payta.

I am not liking my job: I made a mistake
in not going directly on down to Lima - or at
least in not going on by the S.S. Chile on July 7.
However I did not. Things are not satisfactory;
except from the standpoint of temperature, but I
judge that I can make them so to a greater
or less degree. At any rate I am sailing
for Lima, "for Consillo"- on the 17 - or 22 - the
first date I hope. Even.

It is cold. I am wearing my woolen under clothes &
my

my Cheriat suit & my over coat occasion-
ally in the evenings! With this weather
it should need only minimal - anti stego-
myia work to rid Peru of Y. F.- but because
of this weather no one wants to do anything
& anis doing very little- I found 3 physi-
cians here in Piura - off their posts- All
with excuses. not with reasonsjustifation for this absence
from duty. AllTwo are back- or at least have
left Piura today- I came here July 9:
& the other one goes tomorrow. The mosquito
work is better than the medical inspection- In
Paita & here it is good. I will see it in Cata-
caos tomorrow & next day & then I leave for Pai
Lima via Payta. I am sending the American
Inspector, Mitchel, back to the northern
10,000 people
2000 pop
3000 pop
towns- Chulacanas: Tambo Grande & Marropon-
to press this work. There was fever in the first on
July 3, & the danger is of it lasting through un-
til summer - November- or say October. I will
visit

visit, or rather I purpose, visiting, these places
when I return. Also Venezuela & Secturia to the
south- The 5 I have named are the only places
of which I have much fear - & indeed not
a great deal of the last two. I really am
sure that a small amount of work is
sufficient - done in July; August & Sept.-
to clear us of fever &, I presume, it is up
to me to get it done. The people here are
so optimistic - as they were so pessimistic
in March & April. I really wish no work had
been done then - more of them had been im-
munized (x see footnote x) & hence a higher stegomyia index
allowable. The only good the summer work
except to train a few inspectors -- and winnow
out many for ones. However if I can get
2 1/2 to 3 1/2 months good work done my coming
here will be justified. What change Gorgas death
has or will make in the plans & in my status I do not
know

I am not to this extent knocked out by my
cold- (1) I am unduly sensitive to cold. es-
pecially to any sudden change of temperature & (2) I
am having, at least had yesterday, twinger
of rheumatism - back of my shoulder. I am
taking pains & am going to take more- Have
borrowed - he would not sell - a set of new
planned underwear (U. S. Army) from Mitchel
(San. Inspector) & “stand by” to put on my kha-
ki spiral putties if needed for my legs.
The trouble is that it is hot in the sun or where
the sun is shining, even out of the sun. I
am going to look out for my health as much as
I possibly can-. When you write please always tell me
what letters you have received. Hasta la Vista
Tambien
y me gustara mucho so pusiea escribin hasta luega

H. R Carter
